more.requirement: Core values: respect, humility, integrity, responsibility, focus, goodness Vocational diploma in: restaurant, hospitality management Minimum 3 years of working experience as shift manager role in restaurant groups Management skills: driving results, delegation, coaching and ability to motivate others Leadership and people skills: supervision skills, interpersonal skills Business skills: keeping high levels of employee and customer satisfaction, maintaining customer loyalty Communication skills: ability to speak, read and comprehend, and converse with people Ability to work on own initiatives
more.description:
Mission (overall purpose of the job): The Shift Manager is responsible for assisting the Assistant Restaurant Manager to maximize sales and revenue through customer satisfaction and employee engagement. He/she also helps the Assistant Restaurant Manager oversee and manage all F&B operations and develop talents.
Key activities: 1. Manage the F&B day-to-day operations within budgeted guidelines and to the highest standards 2. Preserve excellent levels of internal and external customer service; identify customersâ€™ needs and respond proactively to all of their concerns 3. Assist the Assistant Restaurant Manager to liaise with Procurement and Accounting department on product purchases, delivery inspections as well as inventory management 4. Accomplish restaurant human resource objectives by recruiting, select, orient, train, assign, schedule rosters, coach, counsel, and discipline employees 5. Assist the Assistant Restaurant Manager to communicate job expectations; plan, monitor, appraise, and review job contributions; plan and review compensation actions; enforce policies and procedures 6. Implement production, productivity, quality, and customer-service standards; resolve problems; complete audits; identify trends; determine system improvements; implement changes 7. Maximize bar profitability by ensuring portion control; monitoring accuracy of charges 8. Assist the Assistant Restaurant Manager to maintain safe, secure, and healthy environment by establishing, following, and enforcing sanitation standards and procedures; comply with legal regulations; secure revenues; develop and implement disaster plans; maintain security and sprinkler systems 9. Maintain ambiance by controlling lighting, background music, linen service, glassware, dinnerware, and utensil quality and placement; monitoring food presentation and service 10. Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations 11. Enhance department and organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments 12. Fulfill other tasks that maybe assigned to help achieve company's goals/objectives.
